titleStmt.title: The true Catholick, and Catholick church described. And the vanity of the Papists, and all other schismaticks, that confine the Catholick church to their sect, discovered and shamed. / By Richard Baxter, a member of that one Universal Church, which containeth all the true Christians in the world. With an apologetical postscript against the factious principles and writings of Mr T. Malpas, Mr T Pierce, Philo-Tilenus, and such others.
titleStmt.author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.

titleStmt.title: The true Catholick, and Catholick church described. And the vanity of the Papists, and all other schismaticks, that confine the Catholick church to their sect, discovered and shamed. / By Richard Baxter, a member of that one Universal Church, which containeth all the true Christians in the world. With an apologetical postscript against the factious principles and writings of Mr T. Malpas, Mr T Pierce, Philo-Tilenus, and such others.
titleStmt.author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A.M. for T. Underhill at the Anchor and Bible in Pauls Church yard, and F. Tyton at the three Daggers in Fleetstrect [sic],

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Malpas, Thomas. A box of spikenhard newly broken; and Jordan, Timothy. A heavenly child; and to Pierce, Thomas.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
